w:r.w:t: This lesson will teach the student about the outside world. They will learn about nature and things outside buildings.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Use terms regarding the outside world
Use sentences to describe things they will find outside
Understand instructions to clap out words, fill in blanks, and circle or underline pictures
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning
about going outside and experiencing things in nature!
Sing the warmup song with the teacher, at the teacher prompt
Teach the student this song and go through
Circle the pictures and point out trees and flowers.
Have the student repeat these words back to you.
Circle the pictures and point out the sky and sun. Have the student repeat these words back to you.
He loves to count the trees!
He counts the trees beside his house
Read this short poem with the student and have them count the trees with you.
Circle the trees as you count. If time allows, teach them about the house and the
. As you draw circles around the picture.
Ask the student to repeat after you.
Have them circle the sun, sky, trees, and flowers
Go through these rhymes with the student. Have them repeat after you.

Circle the trees, flowers, sun, and sky

“Trees, flowers, sun, and sky are outside!”
Describe the outside, and have the student repeat after you while circling these things outside
“What is the girl playing with?” while circling the ball
“The girl is playing with the ball outside
he girl is in the tree”
Count out the flowers with the student.
ask the student what color the flowers are
Circle the picture that is yellow
Clap out the syllables with the student. Focus primarily on pronunciation of these words.

Ask, “What is outside?” and have the student circle the picture and repeat the sentence for each of these objects.

“I do not love to play outside.”
Use TPR to demonstrate this question. “Do you love to play outside?”
Have the student answer with a full sentence.

rough the motions with the student
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
If the student is ready, you can introduce other objects that might be outside.
If you can, prepare with objects of simple items that you might find outside.
Ask students to tell or demonstrate what they do outside.
“Can you say something about the outside?”
Ask the student if they can progress on any words they might know about the outside, trees, sky, sun, or flowers.
